channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery sues NBA to secure media rights awarded to Amazon
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery has sued the NBA in an effort to keep distributing the league's games, after it chose NBCUniversal and Amazon as new media partners.

item.title: UK Finance Minister Rachel Reeves pledges most 'pro-growth, pro-business' government the country has seen
item.description: U.K. Finance Minister Rachel Reeves said Friday that the new Labour government would be the most pro-growth and pro-business the country has seen.

item.title: Fed’s key inflation gauge rose 2.5% in June from a year ago, easing path to rate cut
item.description: The PCE price index was expected to increase 0.1% in June and 2.5% from a year ago.

item.title: Eurostar cancels quarter of train services ahead of Olympics after arson attacks on French railway
item.description: French railway operator SNCF said in a statement its network had experienced several concurrent attacks on Thursday night, with fire damaging its facilities.

item.title: Venezuela’s Maduro bids for a third term in power — as U.S., Brazil warn over need for free election
item.description: Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro will seek his third term in office on Sunday in a vote that's regarded as the country's most open contest in more than a decade.

item.title: Melania Trump's memoir set for Sept. 24 release, weeks before election
item.description: The former first lady has remained conspicuously absent from the campaign trail as Donald Trump seeks a second term in office.

item.title: Bill Ackman's IPO of Pershing Square closed-end fund is postponed, NYSE says
item.description: Bill Ackman is postponing the highly scrutinized listing of Pershing Square's U.S. closed-end fund, according to a notice on the NYSE's website.

item.title: Apple's no longer among top 5 smartphone vendors in China as domestic brands dominate market
item.description: Apple's smartphone market share in China declined 2% in the second quarter as it faces intensifying rivalry from rivals like Huawei, a Canalys report showed.

item.title: Nvidia supplier SK Hynix to build $6.8 billion chip plant in South Korea
item.description: SK Hynix's plant will be in the Yongin Semiconductor Cluster where the South Korean government is looking to build a massive complex of chip operations.

item.title: Here's how much it can cost a family of four to live across 10 major Asian cities
item.description: Here's approximately how much a family of four will pay for cost of living in these 10 major Asian cities.

item.title: Obama endorses Kamala Harris as she builds momentum against Donald Trump
item.description: The Obamas' highly anticipated endorsement could give Harris campaign a boost as it builds momentum to rival that of Donald Trump.

item.title: Crypto firm Ledger hikes prices of iPod-inspired wallet by 40% and launches new mid-tier option
item.description: Crypto firm Ledger is increasing the price of Ledger Stax, its iPod-inspired hardware wallet, and releasing a similar, cheaper device, called Flex.

item.title: FAA approves SpaceX to resume Falcon 9 rocket launches after two-week hiatus
item.description: The FAA approved SpaceX to resume flights of its mainstay Falcon 9 rocket after being grounded about two weeks ago following a rare inflight failure.

item.title: Rich Chinese travelers are flocking to Tokyo to take advantage of the weak yen
item.description: LVMH, Kering and Burberry all noted an uptick in sales from travelers to Japan, despite weaker sales in China that weighed on overall results.

item.title: OpenAI announces a search engine called SearchGPT; Alphabet shares dip
item.description: OpenAI announced a prototype of its SearchGPT search engine on Thursday.

item.title: Airlines roll out business seat upgrades at Farnborough Airshow as demand for lucrative cabin class set to rise
item.description: Qatar Airways and Turkish Airlines showcased new business class products at the event.

item.title: CrowdStrike CEO says 97% of Windows sensors back online after major outage
item.description: Last week, CrowdStrike issued a routine update to its users around the world that contained a bug which caused Microsoft's Windows operating system to crash.

item.title: Japan's Nikkei falls for eighth straight day amid a broader gain in Asia-Pacific markets
item.description: Inflation in Japan's capital city of Tokyo is widely considered a leading indicator of price increases in the country.

item.title: Want to avoid giving your kid a smartphone? Mental health experts say you're not alone — and have 5 tips
item.description: It's hard to avoid giving your child a smartphone in this new digital age but mental health experts say it starts with having strong boundaries as a parent.

item.title: How Visa employed artificial intelligence to check $40 billion in fraud as scammers also take to AI
item.description: The payments giant said it prevented $40 billion worth of fraudulent transactions from October 2022 to September 2023, nearly double from a year ago.

item.title: She spent four months in France and Spain on a $6,000 budget
item.description: Rowena Hennigan took a self-funded sabbatical from work to rest and reset, spending four months in Europe on a shoestring budget. Here is how she made it work.

item.title: Samsung hints at new products as it bets on AI to drive upgrades to its latest foldable phones
item.description: Samsung Electronics' mobile boss TM Roh discussed Galaxy AI and software strategy, while hinting at future foldable products and mixed reality headsets.

item.title: 'Deadpool & Wolverine' set for highest opening of an R-rated film
item.description: Disney and Marvel's "Deadpool & Wolverine" is expected to shatter box office records and become the highest opening film with an R-rating.

item.title: U.S. Secretary of Commerce talks domestic chip production: 'There's no place to be reckless here or play politics'
item.description: In a Thursday interview with CNBC's Jim Cramer, U.S. Secretary of Commerce Gina Raimondo stressed the importance of domestic chip production.

item.title: 'It is time for this war to end,' Harris tells Netanyahu; 'I will not be silent' on Palestinian suffering
item.description: Harris' remarks followed a meeting she held with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in Washington Thursday.

item.title: U.S. economy grew at a 2.8% pace in the second quarter, much more than expected
item.description: Gross domestic product in the second quarter was expected to show a 2.1% annualized increase.

item.title: $1 million hypothetical portfolios: How kids from wealthy families at an elite Swiss school learn about money
item.description: Bernhard Gademann, president of an elite Swiss boarding school, has a strategy to cater to the children of parents who pay more than $160,000 in tuition a year.

item.title: Chinese EV startups are spending more on research than Tesla is
item.description: U.S.-listed Chinese electric car companies are spending more on research as a ratio to sales than Tesla, according to CNBC analysis.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: The tax with potential side effects
item.description: The Indian government is borrowing a page from 17th-century England over taxation, but modern Britain holds the clue to some of its side effects.

item.title: Kamala Harris debuts official TikTok account as presidential campaign picks up
item.description: Kamala Harris debuted an official TikTok account on Thursday, underscoring the social broadcasting app's importance to the 2024 presidential campaign.
